channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Ido Leshem

item.title: Baseline Grid
item.description: Simple CSS+SVG solution to help with vertical rhythm As web designers, we are constantly concerned with the concept of rhythm. Rhythm gives clarity and order to our designs, making our websites more readable and less cluttered. I tend to think of rhythm as two separate, yet interlaced, spacing systems in both axes. On the horizontal axis, many designers use some form of a grid (i.e the famous 960 grid system).

item.title: Slots Rush
item.description: Slots Rush is a new kind of slots, bringing fast paced action to the classic game of chance. Spin the wheels as many times as you can in 60 seconds and earn prizes and surprises. I was in charge of the UI design, branding, and overall art direction.

item.title: Captain Up
item.description: Captain Up maximizes user engagement and lifetime value, using gamification, social and communication tools. The team approached me early-on to kickstart the brand and design their website and gamification component UI/UX.

item.title: Chimps Ahoy!
item.description: An experimental HTML5 mobile-friendly web game, released also as a mobile app. In Chimps Ahoy! players take the role of an aspiring pirate, leading an army of monkeys across an extremely vast open world which can be freely explored for loot and adventures. Check out the game here!

item.title: Flying Dodo
item.description: Flying Dodo is a simple mobile action game, where the player controls Wilbur the Dodo as he flies through the jungle and collects coins to upgrade the jetpack and avoid the evil birds of the jungle. I was in charge of the UI, characters and art direction.

item.title: Jungle Jelly Twist
item.description: Jungle Jelly Twist is small puzzle game, designed for mobile web. Spin the board to either side to match the Jellies with each other. Fun fact, the whole game took about 3 days to make. To learn more and play, visit this page.

item.title: Sneaky James
item.description: Sneaky James is a mobile-friendly web stealth game, released also as a mobile app. The player takes control over a cat burglar, using timing and careful planning to outwit the guards and get away with the loot. The game’s art style was inspired by Film Noir and detective movies, but had to be kept casual enough to appeal to younger audiences. Play Sneaky James here!

item.title: Dynamons World
item.description: Released for mobile platforms and as an HTML5 mobile-friendly web game, Dynamons World is played by millions of players worldwide. Featuring an exciting storyline and fun characters, players can battle each other in the Online Arena and explore the game to find and catch unique creatures. All backgrounds are completely hand-drawn, designed to feel like background art from an animated series. To learn more and find out where to play, visit this page!

item.title: Piratelands TD
item.description: Piratelands TD is a challenging HTML5 mobile-friendly web mini-game, where the player is tasked with guarding the treasure from invading pirates by placing towers and traps along their path. For more details and a playable demo, check out this link.

item.title: Double Duck
item.description: Double Duck is a game studio I have co-founded in 2012. The studio has produced over 50 mobile games, many of them targeted at various HTML5 platforms, and has worked with major international brands to bring quality content to millions of players worldwide. Logo evolution Visit the Double Duck site to learn more.
